intro: Erodium turkmenum, commonly known as Turkmen stinkcup, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and the flowers are usually pink or purple, attracting pollinators such as bees. Erodium turkmenum is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
